title: Special Project
description: Andy puts Dwight in charge of a special project in Tallahassee, but Dwight doesn't like the team Andy's assembled for him. Meanwhile, Darryl tries to figure out the meaning of Val's Valentine's gift.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh ho! Look who's back reporting for duty.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey guys!

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [laughing] Hi.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Pam! Ahh! Look what I can do now that she's no longer pregnant. [pretends to punch Pam in the stomach] Bam! Bam! Bam! Bam!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Are you glad to be back?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. Yeah, I mean I could have used another week, or three.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: You still had eight weeks more than we did.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [laughing] Well, it's not exactly a vacation.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Hello everyone! Remember little old me. Hi!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What are you doing here? You just had our baby. Our collective Dunder Mifflin...family baby. Four days ago.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I wanted to come back to work. Not everybody needs some long luxurious Parisian maternity leave. [removes coat]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Damn girl! Your body!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Angela, you look amazing.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Really? I feel like this big rhinoceros. Anyway, I wanted to thank you guys for covering for me so I made some treats. I've got brownies and magic cookie bars.

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: [murmurs of delight as people shuffle toward the treats]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh Angela, those brownies have walnuts in them and I think Kevin's allergic to walnuts. You're allergic to walnuts, right Kevin?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Extremely, but I'm gonna fight through it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Aw. It's OK Angela. I have mommy brain too.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don't know what that is, Pam. I made a batch with no nuts, special for you Kevin, right here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: When did you find time to do all this?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Babies sleep a lot Pam, if you feed them enough. Brownie Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you. [takes bite] Oh my gosh. It's really good.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I wouldn't know, I'm watching my weight. Ugh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So you guys, you know what's an even more useful treat...is cash. So-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope. It's over.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: ...we wanted to say thank you-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope. OK.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dwight, I have exciting news for you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I think you're going to like it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You can't tantalize me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oooh, maybe I can. [slowly] I got an email... from corporate....that told me that...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK. [looks at watch and leaves]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That...[quickly] you got a promotion! [Dwight turns back] Right? I mean that's not the kinda thing you wanna read quietly at your desk.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If you make me head of sales one more time, I swear.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, this is legit. You will be assembling a team to go to Tallahassee for three weeks to develop and launch a chain of Sabre stores.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes! Yes! Yes! Yes! Yes! Yes! Yes! Yes! Yes! Yes, yes, yes, hi-yes! Yeah yeah yeah yeah!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The Shrutes have a word for when everything comes together in a man's life perfectly: Perfectinschlag. Hmm. Right now, I am in it. I finally get a chance to prove myself to corporate, I am assembling a competent team, I am likely a father, I am so deep inside of perfectinschlag right now. And just to be clear, there is a second definition, "perfect pork anus" which I don't mean.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: And here's the fax for you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And here's some facts for you. Did you know frogs can hear with their lungs? And that flamingos can have orgasms that last 30 minutes.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Ah! Love to learn.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, it's weird that I said that last one.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: So... [points out their matching heart pins]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Uh yeah, look at that.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: We're pin twins.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Pin twins! This is a gift from Jessica, kind of a gag gift really. Real gifts come later.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah. That's cute. When I saw it in CVS it made me gag too. [Andy laughs, walks away, Erin throws away her pin]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: For a while there I thought something would change. But nope. Andy's still with Jessica, they even carpool together most days. I don't know, I wouldn't mind carpooling every day with Andy, but I wouldn't want to spend that much time with Jessica.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What do we have here?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Val knit me a beanie. But I can't if it's a "we're just friends" beanie or a "I'm hot, you're hot, let's get it poppin'" beanie. So I'm gonna up the ante, give her a clearly romantic gift, and we'll get to the meaning of the beanie.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pam, pack up your post-natal swimwear, make it a one piece or this offer is rescinded, and join me on a fantastic barbeque one week from today in Tallahassee, Florida where I'm going to be living for the next three weeks.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mm hm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'll fly anywhere for some good barbeque.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ooh, me three.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Eh! No plus one's. This is for competent workers only. And don't worry about the cost, Sabre is footing the bill.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Does this have anything to do with what you were talking to Andy about?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: God, you're such a spy.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [clears throat] Notice anything different about me?

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: You're wearing the beanie. You like it?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Super comfortable. Like sweatpants for my head.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: I love it too Val. It's it's really itchy, uh but to be fair my head is constantly itching so I can't really peg it on the hat.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [noticing all the warehouse workers wearing homemade beanies] Wow. It's like the nation of Islam down here.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: I like to knit, don't hate. And who's that for?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh, this is a gift, for....my man Nate here.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: Darryl, you shouldn't have.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: Can I open it?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No, no, no. Maybe just later.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: Ah, I can't wait. I'm sorry. I get too excited. [opens gift] Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Wow. Those are really nice.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: They're so elegant.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Cashmere.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: How'd you know?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Just a hunch. Your gift is on the way.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Can't wait.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: [reading card] "I'm glad you're in my life. Happy Valentine's Day." Ugh, Darryl. I am glad to be in your life too. Oh, your card is more beautiful than the gloves.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: My first task as special project manager Dwight Shrute? Assembling a crack team. I need people who are loyal. People who'll help me get an inroad with the gay Hispanic community. People who won't be missed. We don't need idiots, good for nothing's, methheads or... What's your name?

quotes.speaker: Kathy
quotes.text: Kathy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Kathy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I just got a text from Robert California that says "bring your clubs to Florida".

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Why? Does he think you're going to Florida?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I hope not. [laughs] Because I am not going. Two question marks?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, just do one. Two question marks is kind of aggressive. You know it's like wha-what?? Just do one.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You wanna take Darryl, Phyllis, Toby, Angela and Oscar?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Can I interest you in someone less essential? Like uh a Creed or a Meredith perhaps?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh my god.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: They're not expendable exactly, I just can't...I can't think of the word I'm trying to find.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Are you kidding me?! I'm supposed to get in an airplane with those nincompoops? We'd never get off the runway.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Alright, look. I gotta keep this office functioning somehow. So, I have put together a list, here's your team. Darryl and Phyllis you can have, but you're also taking Kathy, Kelly and Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh god.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You have your team.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Kevin!? Kelly!? Kathy!? Andy just gave me a chain with three weak links. Have you ever tried to use a chain with three weak links? I have. And now I no longer own an arctic wolf.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, let's hear it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: "Robert, Hey!" Exclamation point.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I like it so far.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: "Got your text, awesome idea. Let's hit the links next time you're in PA" Dash JH.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's perfect. You emphasized the golf, completely omit the Florida.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, it's a golf text.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Total golf text. Send it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Duh- Wait. I just feel weird. I should just call him.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You wanna call someone? That texted you!? Do you wanna drive them away? I mean, ugh.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [on phone] This is Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Bob
quotes.text: Oh, sorry I asked for the main shipping number. I just need the address for the warehouse? I want to send my girlfriend some flowers.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Your girlfriend? Is your girlfriend Val?

quotes.speaker: Bob
quotes.text: Yeah, do you know her?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: We're friends. We're friends.

quotes.speaker: Bob
quotes.text: Cool. Um, so can I get that address or...?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah sorry, I'm just looking for a pen.

quotes.speaker: Bob
quotes.text: Why do you need a pen?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Back off! I got my reasons.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: May I have your attention please? Could Kathy, Darryl, Phyllis, Kevin and Kelly please join me in the conference room immediately?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, no big deal. It's just that you five have been deemed most deserving of a three week all expenses paid business trip to Tallahassee, Florida.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Hell yeah.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: What?!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, I'm sorry Stanley, I can't share any more details with you. You see, Andy rejected you.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Wait. Kathy gets to go? Uh, why does she even still work here? Pam is back.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It just feels like a slap in the face.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can understand your pain and your rage, but you know what? Andy is an honorable man, let us not question his choices. I'm sure he had his reasons.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: We're not questioning his reasons. I just wanna know what they are.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know, you and me both, brother. It seemed kinda random to me, but he was pretty clear on who he thought truly deserved this boondoggle of a lifetime.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well, he nailed it because I do deserve a vacation. Sometimes Batman's gotta take off his cape.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good point. But we're gonna be working pretty hard until five PM. After that it's gonna be beach volleyball, trips to Cape Canaveral, and sea kayaking with Gloria Estefan.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What are the criteria for going?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It might be innate goodness versus innate badness? But there's an easy way to find out. [knocks on Andy's office door] Oh Andy, gotta few questions for you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Mooshie mooshie. [Dwight laughs]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, the Florida picks got out, and people were just kind of curious as to why they weren't picked and maybe you could just clarify?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well uh...well the deliberations were confidential so...I feel like we should respect that.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Respect it? You're trying to tell me Kevin Malone deserves more than Stanley Hudson.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Ok, it's obvious Andy picked the people that are least important to the office.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Important? Oh because you and your enormous monster baby are so important to the branch.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: My baby is not a monster!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey. Be proud of your enormous monster baby. I was once an enormous monster baby.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Guys. Guys. Guys. Come on, seriously? We cannot let this trip cause this kind of rift, guys!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Stop calling us "guys".

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I use the word "guys" a lot when I'm nervous...guys.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Guys! Guys! Guys!

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Stop it!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Guys..

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Stop. Stop it Andy.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: ...Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dudes...the dudes who are going to Florida were picked by Dwight and me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK hey. I specifically remember there were a lot of other people I thought should be considered.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wha-

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: If anybody's going to Florida, it should be me. Every shirt I have that isn't a work shirt is a Tommy Bahama. I'm the only person in this office who watches Burn Notice.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: OK, I did not realize that so many of you wanted to go so badly, so if you feel like you have a very good reason to go to Florida, I'm happy to hear you out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Great idea! So why doesn't everyone just take the next five to six hours, come up with a statement on why you feel you deserve to go to Florida and Andy and I will listen to it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No. That is a ridiculous waste of time.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: For you maybe.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Five to six hours?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Three to four hours.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No no no no.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Two to three hours...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come up with a statement in the next hour....

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thirty minutes!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I'm out.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok, read it back to me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [reading text] Robert, great offer. Wish I could hit the links with you in Florida but a father of a newborn really should be helping out his wife any chance he gets.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Good. Doesn't sound pushy...you're just stating a fact.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Absolutely. Works for me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, sending.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well done. And we managed to kill the entire morning.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really did [Text bleep] He responded L-O-L.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [laughs exaggeratedly]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I have a new swimsuit I need to break in....

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I am...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have already picked my team: Darryl, Oscar, Angela, Phyllis and Toby and that is the team that I am taking. What's that? It's not up to me? I only have influence? Well, that's all Baltzer Gladfielder had and no one eats owls for Thanksgiving.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You have two young dynamic people in this office who know trends, who know youth. That's myself and Kelly Kapoor, you need one of us there.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Or both?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Not both. Just one, me. Or if not me, Kelly. Ideally me. Again, youth knowledge. That's what you get when you put Ryan Howard on your special project team...or Kelly Kapoor. Again, not both. Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Very impressive. He put a lot of work into that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mm-hm. Powerpoints are the peacocks of the business world. All show, no meat.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Because I feel like that I'm in a place with my gambling rehab that I can finally start going to dog racing again. You know, just sitting, watching, enjoying the sport? Maybe putting down a few dollars if there's like a crazy mismatch or something...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok. Thank you Kevin, we'll let you know.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: When do we leave?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: It has been a long, lonely winter.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wow. Seasonal effective disorder, AKA: sad. That sounds like a very real thing, Toby.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: It is real, thank you for saying that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, wow. It's almost like we're not all experiencing the same winter?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Florida Stanley smiles. Florida Stanley is happy to go to work. Florida Stanley is who you want on your Florida team.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Maybe it's what she does here...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hey guys, any spots left?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Erin, you wanna go to Tallahassee?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I do. I really do. I think it would be a nice way to clear my head.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know I don't think it's a good idea for you to clear your head any more than it has been already. I think you need a workplace where the burdens of everyday life keep you tethered to reality.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Either or. But if you can find someone to fill in, I would love to go.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well it wouldn't be hard to find someone to fill in..

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Really? Oh, great. Good, ahem, good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Now, is it too dark to say that Cici's having an operation?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I think you need to go to Florida.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think you're right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's only for three weeks, you know with my mom and sister at the house it'll be..

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Total nightmare.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I was going to say good because I'll have all the help I need?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, that's what I'm saying. They're incredibly helpful, you're lucky to have them. I mean with them there, you probably won't even know I'm gone.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Exactly.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, [Jim enters] No! No! Absolutely not! You are not going. Over my dead body, no. Andy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Tuns, I'm really sorry. You're too essential to the operation here, I can't let you go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I wouldn't say that...it's a bit much.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know Dwight, if you didn't want me to go the smart move would be to tell Andy that I actually am essential to the operation. That way I couldn't go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim is essential to th-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hold on, just wanna get it on camera. [holds up cellphone]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Andy, Jim is just too...essen-...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Essential.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is stupid! Cut.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright, I'm gonna pack my trunks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He doesn't even want to go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I got a text from RC inviting me to come down so I think that's gonna make us roomates.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh my god.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, quick question: Do you shower at night or in the morning? Cause I wanna shower when you're showering. Save some water.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: OK, listen up everyone, here's who's going to Florida: Kathy..

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: ....Stanley..

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: ...Ryan...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: ...Erin...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: (Bleep)

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: ...And, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You've gotta be (bleep)-ing kidding me. Ok. Ok, Florida group, welcome to the team. [goes into conference room and slams door] AHHHHH!!!!!!!!!!!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let's go, step it up you runts. You infants, let's move.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Why is it so hot in here?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hot? What are you talking about? This is a nice temperate Florida morning. Eighty-five degrees, seventy-five percent humidity. This is the exact environment you will be facing for the next three weeks of your life. Welcome to special projects orientation. The next three weeks of your life are gonna be the most miserable you've ever faced. They're gonna be hard, they're gonna be dirty. You're gonna wish you were dead.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: But...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But? There's not buts. That's it. You'll wish you were dead. You seem a little disturbed, you wanna stay here?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No no, I want to go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Cause if any of you would prefer to stay here, all you need to do is ring this bell. [holds up Taboo buzzer]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is that the buzzer from Taboo?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: SHUT UP MAGGOT! YOU DON'T WANT TO GO, RING THE BELL! RING IT! Ring it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How many of you have seen the documentary Deliverance?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: How did a mosquito get in here?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I released three hundred mosquitoes in the conference room, just temporarily. When I'm done, the frogs will take care of the mosquitoes. [Frog in plastic cage ribbits]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, when he brushes your soft supple cheeks with his worn leathery hands and says "I'm gonna make you the seventh Mrs. Rosenblatt" unless you ring this bell. Ring it! Ring the bell. You wanna spend the rest of your life changing your husband's colostomy bags? Huh? Do you? Ring it! Wha-, [Jim slaps Dwight's forehead] oh. What was that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mosquito.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Sighs and grunts] Orientation is over.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: Oh Darryl, hey.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey what's up? You called?

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: Yeah, you know I, I felt really terrible that you got me these lovely gloves and I didn't get you anything...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It's cool really.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: No, it's anything but cool. Now I haven't really had time to go out and buy you anything, but uh, here goes. [Hands Darryl pink slips of paper]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: "This coupon entitles you to one free tickle monster attack"

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: Yeah, they're Nate coupons. Or Nate-pons. And they're all different. Cash that one in and I will bring you a stick of gum, anytime, any place. I'll find you.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Thanks. [to Val] Nice flowers.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Thanks, they're from my mom.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Your mom?

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Uh. So I guess that was your mom who called me earlier looking for the address? Real deep voiced woman?

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Yeah, that's her.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: She said her name was Brandon, I think. Your mom's name is Brandon?

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: [laughs] Yeah Darryl, my mom's name is Brandon.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Then I guess I figured out where I stand. This is a love beanie.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, Florida team, let's reconvene.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I'm going to Florida.....and I'm not coming back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So Sabre has set up a conference room for our use while we're at corporate.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, what is this special project?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Basically Sabre has tasked us with helping them branch into the retail marketplace. They want to set up their own version of an Apple store.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That sounds awesome.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It did, it did.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You know what might be great? Is if instead of a genius bar we have a lounge area where people can ask questions about the product with other customers who liked it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah. And they should have a place where people can check their computers or printers before they see you so you don't have to carry it around like a dope. Like a coat check. [Dwight writes on whiteboard] Oh, don't write it down unless you like it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, I like it.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: It seems to me that the Apple store is kind of like a party. So I think our question is: How do we make this a better party?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. We sell business tools and the stores need to reflect that. They need to be all business. Let all the other stores look like a toy store.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Right. Think different, from Apple.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight, is now a good time to go over what you expect of us?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [long pause] Yes. What are my expectations for the group?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have been given the responsibility to manage Stanley, a solid player, Ryan, who is capable of surprises, Erin, an excellent follower and Kathy, a probably not totally useless enigma. And, well, Jim. Under the right manager, that's not a bad team. Perfectinschlag.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I don't know how I'm going to live here without you.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Me neither. Hey, will you put this coat on my chair? I just realized I'm not going to need it down there.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yes, I will take your coat. And I will keep it with me, and I will sleep with it because it smells like you.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No, no, no, no. Just put it on my chair.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Alright [kiss]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Bye. Call me when you land.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I will.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Safe travels.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Goodbye for a very very long time.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, K. It's only three weeks.

quotes.speaker: Kathy
quotes.text: [On phone] All expenses paid. Yeah, Jim's gonna be there. Their marriage is not good. Nobody knows better than me. Definitely we will. It's three weeks in Tallahassee, what else is there to do?
